title: Move version numbers to properties.
body:
Move version numbers to properties.

Goals:
- Consolidate version numbers into the parent POM.
  - However, we can't do this for `guava-bom`: It (by design, per cl/222112576) doesn't have `guava-parent` as a parent.
  - Of course, another way to consolidate version numbers is to use `dependencyManagement`. It's possible that we should use `dependencyManagement` either more or less than we currently do. I'd have to reread https://github.com/google/guava/commit/71a16d5a7496857a1faf51f9b4098d1f26fe6cd6, https://github.com/google/guava/issues/6654, and maybe some other things.
- Get `versions-maven-plugin` to bump our plugins. Normally, it bumps only _dependencies_. But if you declare properties for your plugins, then it will bump those, too. See https://github.com/google/guava/commit/068e94d5dc81b6c4eac9941c474295294324a520.
  - This is useful because we don't have Dependabot set up for Guava for Reasons.
  - I haven't actually bumped the versions in this CL. But I tested and saw good results with `mvn org.codehaus.mojo:versions-maven-plugin:2.19.1:{update-properties,use-latest-releases} -DgenerateBackupPoms=false -Dmaven.version.ignore='(?i).*-(alpha|beta|m|rc)([-. ]?\d+)?' -Dexcludes=org.mockito:mockito` (I should probably have run it on `guava-bom`, too.)
  - A version bump _might_ help with [the "Unauthorized (401)" errors](https://github.com/google/guava/actions/runs/18097804967/job/51494676657) we began seeing after we bumped to Java 25 in https://github.com/google/guava/commit/57528113f64c5e7544fd3153301cde1831f4d673, but I suspect not, as discussed in post-submit commentary on that CL.

This CL comes courtesy of Gemini-CLI, which made a mistake (specifically, neglecting to use the `exec-maven-plugin.version` property that it defined) that was caught by a subsequent Gemini review.

RELNOTES=n/a
author: copybara-service[bot]

files_changed.patch:

+      <version>${junit.version}</version>
     </dependency>
     <dependency>

+    <truth.version>1.4.5</truth.version>
